comments.body: I think they should just drop leather directly with a 100% chance of dropping one leather, making them a decent source, and so far more useful.

Thank you Iron Sniper for the comment, and you are right, it would make the Rabid Bats a viable source of leather should you come across a large colony. However I think that it would make explorers in caves kill all bats in caves rather then be cautious
That's a rlly good idea and they should sleep at night aswell
But some mobs are different like wolves sleep in the day and frogs like the rain
I agree, it would make Minecraft a bit more realistic, and you wouldn't have to wait 10 minutes for a cat to approach you and allow you to feed it fish.
Villagers get stuck behind flower pots and lanterns so often it legitimately made me stop converting villagers from zombies. The AI is insufferable.
इत इस नोट फिक्स
Indeed, this would be very appreciated. However, I want you to be more specific about any tweaks that you want to mention. And try to make the title say what you are writing about.

Mob AI hasnt really changed since they were added, especially villagers. It would be great if you fixed the way mobs pathfind, how hostile mobs pathfind to the player, and how some neutral mobs act, gerg made a video on this, and you should look to that for ideas

NEW IDEAS

If a blue slime is within one block of water it will turn the water to ice

If a blue slime is within one block of lave it will turn the lava into stone and it will become a normal slime.
There could also be red slimes that are found underground.
This would make the cold biomes like ice spikes, frozen oceans & snowy forests much less boring
Great idea! I was thinking the tundra was a little empty.

I use bats all the time. Their constant random movement is the only decent device for creating random redstone activation, which has a unique aesthetic when used with redstone lamps. They are too easy to find and kill to be used to detect mobs.

This idea is great!

I always wanted bats to be useful

This would be very useful for the larger/deeper caves featured in the Caves Update.

For the sake of balance, this awareness effect should last longer than the night vision effect, but the ease in finding bats, and the limited utility of seeing glowing mobs, would also help to counterbalance.
what do you mean by “strength 200”? And, by 6,5 do you mean 6.5, or do you mean 65?
I believe he meant durability 200, 6.5 damage, and 5 seconds of poison.
Oh. Alright, thanks.
I regret to inform you that unlike shearing wool from sheep and pumpkins from snow golems, skin removal would likely be much more harmful to the animal. It would be borderline cruelty.
umm... shearing skin off hurts and kills. And it’s brutal
its called leather
Also even if you sheared a cow, your shearing thier skin they'd die anyway.
Yea, I think killing them is better than skinning them alive and hoping that they will magically regrow their skin....
That's not how it works...
What would they look like sheared the snowman is derpy the sheep is like real life but a cow I’d rather not think about it......
you know if you cut the skin off a cow, it will die. It would bleed to death
New type of cow skinless cow allows you to get blood to start the blood moon ritual. #Should be added to minecraft
this is so illogical in so many ways.
I hate how so many people are getting mad because this is illogical. This is Minecraft, and Minecraft doesn't need logic as long as it is fun.

I read all the comments and I agree that this is a game. It's not made to be realistic. I think shearing cows is a great idea. I was going to post something about shearing cows and I'm glad someone did it. Also everyone is aloud to be as creative as they like.
I think its a cool idea, but it would be a little weird, even for Minecraft. Maybe there could be a game option to turn on or off "shearing" cows.
That is the most ridiculous thing I HAVE EVER HEARD. Would you like it if someone sheared off all of your skin?!?!
What would the texture of a sheared Cow even look like, it would just be flesh and bone
While Minecraft does not have to be realistic, WHAT WOULD A COW LOOK LIKE WITHOUT SKIN? That is as gross as it is cruel
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360018719431-biome-of-unfortunate-events for post being referenced here

Why does there have to be a boss mob for each monster?

Answer: there doesn't.
This will make Minecraft a little too big
Not every mob needs to have an alpha of themselves. Do you really think that Endermites should have a boss of themselves?
This almost sounds like how real dolphins treat sharks... :(
This is a nice idea, but we also have a flying hostile mob on the way, Phanthom. Still, good idea!
This is pretty much what I was going to post, but I was going to say shulker meat because they look like oysters. Either or would be great.

Shulker Shells could be dyed individually and then constructed into a shulker box, giving them different colors on the top and bottom. To give the shells more uses, I would have them be the only way to make shulker boxes with multiple colors, instead of being able to click the top or bottom with dye (not a feature just an example)
Shulker shells could be used for resistance potions.
I've been getting excessive amounts of shells. Not sure why you aren't getting any.
Wait, does purpur burn? It would make sense if it did sense they are made out of popped chorus fruit. Though the shulker inside is made out of end stone.
They should take fire damage when they open up but when closed I can see this happening.
This sounds great! What if they would play wrestle with any other pet foxes you have and cats? I think that would be adorable!
Pure perfection, the desert needs more life!
Please no nepotism/lim1ting it to just wolves, there are other tame-able mobs that also need AI improvements.
I would like to add to this idea that if the dog is low on HP, then instead of attacking hostile mobs, he will just run around the player until he feeds his pet and replenishes his HP.
I think that's a great idea, especially if the bell had a chance to appear randomly, particularly on the cows that are with the farmers in the villages.
Maybe cows with bells don’t despawn?
Or bells for any animals (cats, dogs, goats and other!)
Like maybe the copper golem, I keep seeing them in YouTube shorts, and they look so cool.

The reason Copper & Tuff lost was mostly due to usability for most players. A random button or moving item frame just isn't that handy for survival or builds. Now their "cool down" mechanics are perfect for what more useful golems should be modeled with to do the following functions:

Guarding-(gloom-like) This golem will patrol around the edge of a lite area and will alarm at nearby hostiles, summoning Iron or snow golems (possibly a new ranged attack golem) it may periodically just chill in a spot. It can be led by a lead but will only alter at hostiles if in a lite area, making it a useful mob to watch your back when solo mining.

Automaters- these golems will tackle grinding tasks for players and have a maintenance or cool-down need to ensure players check up on them. Fishing, Farming, Lumber harvesting (log block breaker), Cobblestone block breaker, and Item sorting; are all tasks players would love to automate, and that could be balanced by golems that do cool-downs or need maintenance periodically. 

Attacking/Defense- this is mostly filled already but; an improved ranged or smart turret that could be limited by actual ammo consumption (buffed by being able to toss potions) and a shield/wall golem that is 2 tall and will move in front of ranged hostiles to block their shots are two niches that need a golem. Beyond ways to improve Iron or Snow which seems unlikely to happen.
i need more golems to spond zombies on

I ran out of space but there are a few more things Id like to add.

Spawn is groups of up to 5.

Cool easter egg: if you do the universal sign of peace! (Double crouch) they bob their heads up and down in return!

You can't move where their roost, or home location manually is but if your base has a supply of food for them, they will move there themselves!

I think this addition would help to raise awareness to the potentially smartest animal other than humans. 
Its a shame that crows have such a bad rep considering their intelligence, and I think Minecraft could help change that!

Ahh! Such a good idea! Maybe if you have high enough crow reputation (ie, gained the trust of multiple crows), you might get a little flock that follows you to bring you presents. They might also sit near the player's spawn point, so you might walk outside your base and find crows galore. Negative crow reputation might result in them harassing you or stealing anything you drop, lol. Encourage crow love, Mojang!
I love this idea! Much more helpful than parrots imo lol

I disagree with the addition of dogs, purely because a lot of dog breeds are highly unethical and dogs and wolves are basically the same animal, where as ocelots and domestic cats are extremely different, hence the change. I do like the idea of a Nether Hound though, so voted.
No features? Just Penguins.
ducks are cool
but what would the duck do?

maybe it could give you duck feathers that you can craft into a cape that you can combine with potions so that it gives you the potion effect when you wear the cape and the cape takes up your chestplate slot.
Thats would be great
